tasks.task: Follow biosecurity guidelines when transporting livestock and poultry.
subtasks: Identify secure entry points at the farm or ranch.
Contact the farmer or rancher for phone number or sign-up instructions.
Have vehicles inspected before entering premises.
Clean trucks and trailers if they are dirty or contaminated.
Sign entry and exit logs, provide contact information, and confirm equipment condition.
Follow designated routes within the premises.
Verify required paperwork (e.g., CVI, bill of lading, bill of sale) before loading animals.
Examine animals before loading and do not load sick or injured animals.
Confirm the number and class of animals loaded and ensure gates are closed.
Log departure time and other relevant information.

tasks.task: Follow biosecurity guidelines when unloading livestock and poultry.
subtasks: Call to gain admittance and follow designated routes.
Verify required paperwork with the producer.
Count and document numbers and classes of animals with the producer.
Sort out and document sick animals upon unloading.
Move transportation equipment to a cleaning area or perform thorough clean-out as soon as possible.

tasks.task: MAINTASK: Follow biosecurity guidelines when transporting livestock and poultry.
subtasks: Identify secure entry points at the farm or ranch.
Contact the farmer or rancher for a phone number or sign-up instructions.
Have vehicles inspected before entering premises.
Clean trucks and trailers if dirty or contaminated.
Sign entry and exit logs, provide contact information, and confirm equipment condition.
Follow designated routes within the premises.

tasks.task: Verify required paperwork before loading or unloading animals.
subtasks: Check for a certificate of veterinary inspection (CVI), certificate of brand inspection (for cattle), bill of lading, and bill of sale.

tasks.task: Examine animals before loading or unloading.
subtasks: Do not load sick or injured animals.
Sort out and document sick animals with the producer.

tasks.task: Ensure correct paperwork and check numbers/guidance after loading or unloading.
subtasks: Confirm the number and class of animals loaded/unloaded.
Ensure all gates are closed during loading.

tasks.task: Maintain vehicle cleanliness.
subtasks: Clean trucks and trailers after unloading.
Move transportation equipment to a cleaning area or perform thorough clean-out as soon as possible.
